channel.title: IAM basics :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Identity Access Management (IAM) basics Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 141 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Explains Identity Access Management at a high level. Include links to child docs in this group. Links to original docs: Identity and Access Management (IAM) overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/iam-overview/ Why is this here?: Respondents with IAM experience level lower that 5 say that they rarely come to the site.

item.title: OAuth and OIDC
item.description: OAuth and OIDC explained Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 147 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: no changes needed to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Links to original docs: OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/oauth-openid/ Page type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic. Such high-level overviews provide developers with a broad understanding of the system’s workings.

item.title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
item.description: Single Sign-On (SSO) at Okta Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 345 Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Answers “What is SSO?”, how it differs from a basic sign in, and “How Okta supports it”. Also “How does a user experience SSO from the Okta End User Dashboard or from another place?

item.title: Multifactor authentication (MFA)
item.description: Multifactor authentication (MFA) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 644 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Explain the basic concept of MFA, and the difference between a Authentication Factor and an Authenticator. Why is this here?: At Oktane 2023, 20% of respondents placed “Multi-factor Authentication” under “IAM Fundamentals”. After discussions with employees (and probably customers as well) there is a misunderstanding of what is a “Factor” and what is an Authenticator".

item.title: User and application sessions
item.description: User and application sessions Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 787 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Introduces the core concepts of user, application, and IdP sessions. Links to original docs: Session management (the definitions of IdP and Application session): https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/session Page type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic.

item.title: Tenants and multi-tenant apps
item.description: Tenants and Multi-tenant apps Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 753 Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: This is a new doc defining what a tenant and multi-tenancy are why it can be good to divide users up into tenants internally what a multi-tenant OIDC app is, or how an app is considered to be multi-tenant at a very high level, how an app knows which tenant to use when a user wants to sign in.

item.title: Single Logout (SLO) and Universal Logout (UL)
item.description: Single Logout (SLO) and Universal Logout (UL) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 754 Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Summary overview of the two sign-out products from Okta, paying special attention to the scenarios in which they will apply. One of the goals is to have readers understand the difference between the two products, their limitations and where to find more info on how to implement them in their apps.

item.title: Identity Governance and Administration (IGA)
item.description: Identity Governance Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 761 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: This guide defines and outlines PAM, IGA, and the differences between them and IAM, and how you have to pay for them separately as they are enabled in different SKUs. Page type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview

item.title: User Lifecycle Management (LCM)
item.description: User Lifecycle Management (LCM) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 759 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: An overview of lifecycle management and why we care about it, or at least why Enterprise app vendors care about it, and what that means for developers who need to incorporate it. Add emphasis on user provisioning and deprovisioning in this doc.

item.title: SAML
item.description: Understand SAML Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 479 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Update the flow charts away from Plant UML to use the Figma design. Links to original docs: SAML: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/saml/ Page type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview
